basics.name: Le Quang Thang
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Ambitious Full Stack Developer with expertise in cloud computing, driven by growth and innovation, seeking new challenges to build impactful solutions and create value for businesses and users.

highlights: Developed a CMS for a gaming system.
Developed and deployed a performance review system used by over 100 employees.
Migrated a legacy system from Docker Compose to Kubernetes.
Contributed to building the design system.
Collaborated with product owners, UI/UX designers, and cross-functional teams.
Mentored a Frontend Developer and a Backend Developer, supporting their growth and technical skills
Achievement: Promoted four times in two years — twice the usual pace — recognizing outstanding contributions.
achievements: Promoted four times in two years — twice the usual pace — recognizing outstanding contributions.

work.summary-TODO: Co-founded General Electric, one of the largest and most diversified industrial corporations in the world.
highlights: Developed key UI components for company-wide projects.
Set up CI pipelines to automate the publishing of frontend core NPM packages.
Translated design wireframes into functional UI components.
Mentored a Frontend Developer, providing guidance and support.
Achievement: Achieved a 100% salary increase within my first year, reflecting exceptional performance.
achievements: Achieved a 100% salary increase within my first year, reflecting exceptional performance.

highlights: Developed a Human Resource Management system.
Managed regular deployments with an Agile approach.
achievements: Optimized Dockerfile, reducing feedback loops by up to 600% (from 60s to 5-10s) for each microservice.

work.summary: Researched Golang, TypeScript, gRPC, and other technologies
highlights: Authored official onboarding documentation for setting up the backend environment, streamlining the process for new team members.
achievements: Authored official onboarding documentation for setting up the backend environment, streamlining the process for new team members.

courses: Studied best practices in front-end/back-end software design for 60-70 hours a week over 3 months.
